workouts.name: The beginner
workouts.description: A simple workout for people who are just at the beginning of their fitness journey. Can also serve as an intensive warm up.

exercise.name: Crunches
exercise.description: The crunch is a classic core exercise. It specifically trains your abdominal muscles, which are part of your core.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

exercise.name: Push-ups
exercise.description: Great push-up form starts with a rigid plank. Your arms should be fully extended, with your hands, elbows, and shoulders all in line, and your feet should be no more than 12 inches apart—the closer together, the more difficult the push-up, because it requires more core activation for stability.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

exercise.name: Squats
exercise.description: A squat is a strength exercise in which the trainee lowers their hips from a standing position and then stands back up.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

exercise.name: Lunges
exercise.description: A lunge can refer to any position of the human body where one leg is positioned forward with knee bent and foot flat on the ground while the other leg is positioned behind.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

exercise.name: Planks
exercise.description: The plank (also called a front hold, hover, or abdominal bridge) is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

exercise.name: Flutter kicks
exercise.description: Flutter kicks are an exercise that works the muscles of your core, specifically the lower rectus abdominal muscles, plus the hip flexors. They mimic a swimming stroke, but are performed on dry land.

workouts.name: The intermediate
workouts.description: The same workout as 'The beginner', but with longer exercise times.

exercise.name: Crunches
exercise.description: The crunch is a classic core exercise. It specifically trains your abdominal muscles, which are part of your core.

exercise.name: Rest
exercise.description: Prepare yourself for the next exercise!

workouts.name: Core destroyer
workouts.description: This workout is focused on training your abs. The exercise is about intensity, so give it your all! Make sure you're warmed up to prevent injury!

exercise.name: Toe touches
exercise.description: Put your legs in the air, and try to touch your toes while keeping your legs straight.

exercise.name: Reverse crunch
exercise.description: Instead of making bringing your upper body up. Bring you Legs towards your Upper body while laying down. Push your hands against the ground to maintain stability.

exercise.name: Leg raises
exercise.description: Lie down and bring you legs up while keeping them straight and holding the rest of your body on the ground.

workouts.description: Fun plank workout for finishing your workout.
workouts.name: Plank finisher

exercise.description: The plank (also called a front hold, hover, or abdominal bridge) is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time.
exercise.name: Plank

exercise.description: The same principle as 'The plank', but this time you'll only lean on your left arm where your left side will be just above the ground and your right side to the sky's direction.
exercise.name: Left side plank

exercise.description: The same principle as The plank, but this time you'll lean on your right arm where your right side will be just above the ground and your left side to the sky's direction.
exercise.name: Right side plank

exercise.description: Great push-up form starts with a rigid plank. Your arms should be fully extended, with your hands, elbows, and shoulders all in line, and your feet should be no more than 12 inches apart—the closer together, the more difficult the push-up, because it requires more core activation for stability.
exercise.name: Push-ups

exercise.name: Squats
